Between obsessiveness and building relationships with your Ideal Candidate Profilethere is still a lot of work to doüîî the biggest mistake in sales is the lack of a funnel. It was a treasure trove of insights and connections in the  British tech industry.As an HR enthusiastI immersed myself in captivating discussions on diversityemphasizing the value of inclusive spaces for innovation and creativity.Talent acquisition was another focushighlighting the importance of cultural fit in building top-performing teams. A strategic talent management roadmap was emphasized for organizational success.#LondonTechWeek #TechConference #HRInsights""How to make a great interview with Sales Manager–ß—É—é –≤—ñ–¥ –º–µ–Ω–µ–¥–∂–µ—Ä—ñ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ —Ç–µ —â–æ —Å–µ–π–ª–∑–∏ –∫–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ —Å–µ–±–µ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞—é—Ç—å –Ω–∞ —Å–ø—ñ–≤–±–µ—Å—ñ–¥–∞—Ö. –Ü —Ç—É—Ç –≤ –Ω–∏—Ö –≤–∏–Ω–∏–∫–∞—é—Ç—å –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è —ñ –æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö–∏ —â–æ —Ä–æ–±–∏—Ç–∏ –¥–∞–ª—ñ? –Ø–∫ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ—Å—Ç—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç–∞ —Ç–∞ –Ω–∞–π–Ω—è—Ç–∏ –¥—ñ–π—Å–Ω–æ –∫–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ–≥–æ?–ú–æ—ó —Ä–µ–∫–æ–º–µ–Ω–¥–∞—Ü—ñ—ó –Ω–∞ —â–æ –≤–∞—Ä—Ç–æ –∑–≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç–∏ —É–≤–∞–≥—É:üßê —è–∫–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –≤–∞—à–æ–≥–æ —ñ–Ω—Ç–µ—Ä–≤'—é? —ñ —á–∏ —î —É –≤–∞—Å —Ü—è —Å—Ç—Ä—É–∫—Ç—É—Ä–∞ –≤–∑–∞–≥–∞–ª—ñ?üßê —è–∫—ñ –Ω–∞–≤–∏—á–∫–∏ —Ç–∞ –¥–æ—Å–≤—ñ–¥ –≤–∞–º –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ–≤—ñ—Ä–∏—Ç–∏ —É –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç–∞?üßê —è–∫—ñ –æ—Å–æ–±–∏—Å—Ç—ñ —è–∫–æ—Å—Ç—ñ —Ç–∞ —è–∫—ñ —Ü—ñ–ª—ñ –≤–∞–º –≤–∞–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ —â–æ–±–∏ –±—É–ª–æ —É –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç–∞?üßê —è–∫–∏–º–∏ –∫–µ–π—Å–æ–≤–∏–º–∏ –ø–∏—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—è–º–∏ –≤–∏ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç–µ –æ—Ü—ñ–Ω–∏—Ç–∏/–∑—Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—Ç–∏ –ø–æ–ø–µ—Ä–µ–¥–Ω—ñ–π –¥–æ—Å–≤—ñ–¥ –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç–∞?üßê –∑—Ä–æ–±—ñ—Ç—å scorecard\xa0 —Ç–∞ –æ—Ü—ñ–Ω—é–π—Ç–µ –∫–∞–Ω–¥–∏–¥–∞—Ç—ñ–≤ –∑–∞ —Ç–∞–∫–æ—é —Å—Ö–µ–º–æ—é. –°—É–±'—î–∫—Ç–∏–≤—ñ–∑–º –≤–∏–¥–∞–ª—è—î—Ç—å—Å—è –≤—ñ–¥—Ä–∞–∑—É.–Ø –Ω–∞–∫–∏–¥–∞–ª–∞ –∫–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∏–π –¥—Ä–∞—Ñ—Ç –¥–ª—è —Å–≤–æ—ó—Ö –∫–ª—ñ—î–Ω—Ç—ñ–≤—è–∫—â–æ –≤–∞–º –∞–∫—Ç—É–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ - –¥–∞–π—Ç–µ –∑–Ω–∞—Ç–∏ –≤ –∫–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç–∞—Ä—è—Ö - –ø–æ–¥—ñ–ª—é—Å—è)#sales #interview""Challenges in Hiring Sales ManagersToday I\'ve spoken to a Sales Leader. It was great to know more about his experience in hiring Sales Managers in the UK. So here are some quick points from our conversation\xa0‚úîÔ∏è Finding and attracting long-term candidates for this role is difficult. You have to do your homework and do productive interviews because the TOP talent candidates can take another offer. The time to hire is about 5-7 weeks (not so much)\xa0‚úîÔ∏è A lot of candidates looking for progress and development. So you have to describe to them this career track in your company\xa0‚úîÔ∏è New generations - new rules. We have to learn more about their motivation and show them that we care\xa0‚úîÔ∏è It‚Äôs harder and harder to find candidates not only with a good knowledge of sales funnel and pre-sales. It\'s too complicated to find strategic Sales with high communication skills\xa0‚úîÔ∏è ""Be Agile"" - both company and candidates have to be flexibleCross-cultural matterbe focused on it every time you decide to hire new people to your team#hiring #sales #team #talent #agile";['6'12'6'13'8'4'4'6'8'1'15'9'42'10'2'12'7'];0

https://www.linkedin.com/in/juliyaefimenko/;Julia Efimenko;WE HELP COMPANIES TO HIRE HIGH-PERFOMANCE TEAMS in EMEA region;" ""ChatGPT VS RecruitingSoChatGPT made a lot of noise when it was launched. For meit‚Äôs like a new tool that can help you to automate some routine tasks. Soby thatyou can increase your productivityand you will have more time to create ‚Äúfresh‚Äù ideas and test new ways for attracting talents to your company.How can recruiters use it?1. Write Boolean search stringsThis is a good option for non-technical recruiters. It won't write you really targeted stringsbut you can generate and improve the queries he suggested. Alsoyou can compare your and his requests - this will help you find more options for new search ideas.2. Create an interview question list by role or interview typeThis function is really cool. Sowhen you're looking for technical candidates or specific rolesyou can generate a lot of new and interesting questions. It also works great for training your question-formation skills.Creating interview questions for each role can be exhaustingbut ChatGPT can generate a list of questions for each position. Among themyou can choose the ones you need the most. This can be a quick way to save time while structuring your interview questions and ensuring that you ask the right questions.3. Candidate engagementThis is always a sensitive topic for recruiters and candidates. Sometimes the answers are delayedand sometimes they are not. This function will help to optimize this part of the recruiter's work and reduce the number of unsent rejections to candidates.ChatGPT can help you write engaging email templates that you can send to candidates throughout every step of the process. Even if the candidate doesn‚Äôt reach out to youyou can send out these emails through every stage of the process to keep them updated on the process. ü§î Just to rememberAlthough ChatGPT is still in beta testingit is an exciting tool that nevertheless has the functionality to automate a lot of administrative tasks.ChatGPT is a new software that uses the GPT-3 language model. This language model is trained to scan the Internet and develop text in a human-likeconversational manner. Many AI solutions have generated text beforebut ChatGPT is different because it‚Äôs fine-tuned to produce conversational textsmaking it hard to tell the difference between AI-written text and human-written text.Recruiters must remember that ChatGPT is a chatbot and can‚Äôt assess a candidate‚Äôs fit for a role or make hiring decisions. It can only provide information and facilitate communication between the company and the candidates. Thereforerecruiters can use it best when using it as a tool.#ai #hiring #chatgtp""Hey networkers–°–∞–º–µ –∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑ —è –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∂—É —Ñ–∞–π–Ω–∏–π –ø–µ—Ä—ñ–æ–¥ —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ—ó –≤ Advisory Institute –∑ Sasha Garcia —Ç–∞ —ó—ó –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥–æ—é –•—Ç–æ –≤–∂–µ –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏–≤ —Å—Ö–æ–∂—É —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ—é - –≤–∏ —è–∫ –Ω—ñ—Ö—Ç–æ –º–µ–Ω–µ –∑—Ä–æ–∑—É–º—ñ—î—Ç–µ. –¶–µ —Ç–∞–∫–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∫–æ–ª—å–Ω–µ –≤—ñ–¥—á—É—Ç—Ç—è –≤—Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏–Ω—ñ –≤—ñ–¥ –Ω–æ–≤–∏–∑–Ω–∏–º–∞—Å—à—Ç–∞–±—É —ñ –≤ —Ç–æ–π –∂–µ —á–∞—Å —Ç–æ—Ç–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞—Ö—É –≤—ñ–¥ –Ω–µ–≤–∏–∑–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—ñ —Ç–∞ –Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ö –¥—ñ–π.–¢–µ–ø–µ—Ä —è –º–∞—é —Ü—ñ–∫–∞–≤—É –¥–ª—è —Å–µ–±–µ —Ü—ñ–ª—å —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —Å–≤–æ—ó –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–∏ —Ç–∞ –ø–æ–±—É–¥—É–≤–∞—Ç–∏ —è–∫—ñ—Å–Ω—É –∫–æ–Ω—Å—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—É –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É –≤ —Å—Ñ–µ—Ä—ñ HR —Ç–∞ –†–µ–∫—Ä—É—Ç–º–µ–Ω—Ç—É. –•–æ—á—É\xa0 –±—É—Ç–∏ –∑–∞–ª—É—á–µ–Ω–æ—é –¥–ª—è —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü—ñ–π –∫–æ–º–ø–∞–Ω—ñ–π –≤ –Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ö —Ä–µ–∞–ª—ñ—è—Ö.–ù–∞—Ä–µ—à—Ç—ñ—è\xa0 –º–∞—é —Å–≤—ñ–π –ø–µ—Ä—Å–æ–Ω–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏–π –∞–º–±—ñ—Ü—ñ–π–Ω–∏–π —Ñ–æ–∫—É—Å –Ω–∞ —Ü–µ–π —Ä—ñ–∫ (–±–æ 2 –æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–Ω—ñ –º—ñ—Å—è—Ü—ñ —É –º–µ–Ω–µ –±—É–≤ –∫–æ–Ω–∫—Ä–µ—Ç–Ω–∏–π —Å–ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ —ñ—Ç–∏ –¥–æ –∑–º—ñ–Ω. –û—Ö —É–∂ —Ü–µ–π –ª—ñ–Ω–∏–≤–∏–π –º–æ–∑–æ–∫ üôÑ)–ê —â–æ —É –≤–∞—à–æ–º—É —Ñ–æ–∫—É—Å—ñ –Ω–∞ —Ü–µ–π —Ä—ñ–∫?";['6'12'6'13'8'4'4'6'8'1'15'9'42'10'2'12'7'];0

https://www.linkedin.com/in/nataola/;Natalia Moklyuk;Product Manager | Founder | Startup Advisor with 7+ years of experience in SaaSITDigital Marketingand Well-being domains;" ""I know it's hard to get a job for junior specialists especially now due to war and economic crisis.Nevertheless hard doesn't mean impossible.üí•Yesyou have to make extra-effortsüí• Yesthe competition is heavierüí• Yesyour career way could be not so straight as you've imagined beforeYesterday I volunteerly interviewed Aliaksei Merzlouwho is an alumni of Roman Zhulpo free mentorship programme for IT project managers. Now I would like to give some advice to beginners.1. I think it's important not to get stuck in learning but to gain work experience.Pet projectsvolunteeringpart-time assistant workany real experience.YesI'm not a fan of low-paid or free jobs too but hard times need extra measures to accomplish a goal.2. Prioritise. Don't try to boost all the skills simultaneously. Pick up 3-4 the most meaningful#prioritise them and put in your calendar.3. Make your own #career plan with a plan with different variations of events to get a job and to achieve your current goal.4. Put actions for getting a job in your calendar. Applyingmotivation letterspreparing for the interviews and working with mistakes after them should become a part of your routine.Yesit's difficult. Yesyou won't get a dream job in one day.I talk to my #projectmanagement mentees every day. Also me and my experienced ex-colleagues PMs don't get their new dream jobs as fast as earlier.Still you can get a job. And you will.P.S. recommend to subscribe to Roman's activity and to hire Alexei as a PM trainee. https://www.linkedin.com/in/glafira-zhur/;Glafira Zhur;Accessibility Lead ‚Ä¢ Google Developer Expert for Web ‚Ä¢ IT Speaker ‚Ä¢ Frontend and Accessibility Mentor;" ""Some of you knowsome of you don'tbut I am color blind. More specificallyI have a fairly severe deuteranomaly.Color vision deficiency is a reality for every 200th woman and every 12th man. That is why we founded the Interessenverband der Farbsehschwachen und Farbenblinden (IFFarb) with some colleaguesmostly men because of the genetic aspect.Our main project Farbsehschwaeche is now available in English.There you will find a simulation tool (programmed by Markus Stahmann) to help you understand how people with CVD perceive the world.A few weeks ago we published an article about three simple rules for CVD-inclusive designwhich is now also available in English: https://lnkd.in/efYmQTQV#1in200women #1in12men""Usability Testing Notion Template (https://lnkd.in/eKfbGnNp)an in-depth template that\xa0includes all steps of testing in one place ‚Äî from recruiting users to reporting results. A neat little helper for keeping track of your testing sessionscollect feedback and analyze it later. So what? yepwe have enormous amount of customersso you have to pay money and keep your opinion with you. But we are sooory.  - You not happy about our behavior? wellyou already payed money and we are veeeery soooory(which means that not wenot anybody elsedon't care about how satisfied are you with our service).The bigger company becomesthe more they forget about  customer satisfaction. Ikea hire new developers and managers to manage this hordes of developersand NON of them can create a super-duper-micro-macro-services which can follow the orderwhich were not delivered on time and send a simple email(something like: we are with youplease keep calm). Maybe it is better to start from firing the teamwith peoplewho does not care about main idea behind any business - customerwho pays you money?""To my networkI'm looking for a new opportunities as Python  and/or Golang developerin Netherlands(AmsterdamUtrecht). https://www.linkedin.com/in/seleznev-artem/;Artem Seleznev;Head of machine learning and analytics department;"[""Remote work is getting a bad rap. Underperforming teamsvanishing culture - this is what I hear constantly.But companies reverting to office life or the hybrid approach need to get this: remote work is a big deal in attracting top talent. Offering just an average salary and some bonus holidays won't cut it. Millennials and Gen-Z professionals are all about freedom and independence; they want morelike the ease of working from home.Stillfeeling stubborn? Good luck hooking the best with minor perks!Truth isthe issue isn't remote work itself‚Äîit's how remote teams are being managed.\xa0The lack of know-how is the real culprit.The book 'Remote' nails it with these insights:1. Office drawbacks: Traditional offices can be unproductive due to interruptions and rigid schedules.2. Flexibility of remote work: Remote work offers freedom to choose when and where to workenhancing productivity.3. Right hires: Remote work requires self-disciplined and independent individuals.4. Trust: Managers should trust remote employees whoin turnneed to be reliable.5. Face-to-face time: Occasional in-person meetings can foster community within remote teams.6. Technology: Use digital tools to enhance remote work effectiveness.To mecommuting to the office feels like a waste of time and resources.You come home drained after an overload of face-to-face interactions and spend countless hours stuck in traffic that could have been quality time with family or pursuing a hobby.The flexibility of remote work also allows you to customize your environment for maximum productivityfree from the one-size-fits-all office setup.#Remotelife\xa0VS\xa0#Officelife""#farewell #gifts–ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä–∫–∏ –¥–ª—è —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã.–ö–Ω–∏–≥–∏ –∏ —É—Ç–æ—á–∫–∏–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–∏–≤–∞—é –Ω–∞—à–µ ""—Ç–∞–π–Ω–æ–µ"" —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ.–ß–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∏—è –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞–ª—Å—è –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–∏—Ç—å–∫–∞–∫–∏–µ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã —è —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏–ª (–æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç–µ –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ ""–ö–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –≥–µ–Ω–∏–µ–≤""–µ—Å–ª–∏ –∏—â–µ—Ç–µ—á—Ç–æ –ø–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –º–æ—Ç–∏–≤–∞—Ü–∏—é) –∏–ª–∏ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —à–∞–≥–∏ –≤ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–º –ø—É—Ç–∏ —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ (""–Ø—Å–Ω–æ–ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω–æ"" –∏–ª–∏ –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∏ –ø—Ä–æ –∞–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º—ã).–£—Ç–æ—á–∫–∏ - —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–∞—à —Ç–∞–π–Ω—ã–π —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞–µ—Å–ª–∏ —É –í–∞—Å —É—Ç–æ—á–∫–∞ —Å –Ω–∞—à–∏–º ""—Ç–∞–π–Ω—ã–º –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º""—Ç–æ –≤—ã –Ω–µ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–µ—Ç–µ—Å—å\xa0–≤ –±–µ–¥–µ (–∏—â–∏—Ç–µ —É—Ç–æ—á–µ–∫ —É —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥ üòâ)–°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ –í–∞–º–º–æ–∏ –ù–ê–°–¢–û–Ø–©–ò–ï –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥–∏!";['927'4'9'24'4'1'7'10'3'3'2'4'4'5'5'3'];0

text_post: 'Hello all!I`m Frontend Developer with 3 years of commercial experience and I`m looking for new career opportunities in Europe.Few words about me:I`m currently working as a Frontend developer.My current technology stack is: ReactNextJSNodeJS.During my developing careerI had been working on lots of projects with different specificssuch as Fin-techentertainmentweb-marketsmetaverse worldsNFTs. I would be glad to show you all of these projects in production). All projects are sticked to accessibility and semantics to correspond to European standards.I believe that to create stablemaintainable and user-friendly softwaredevelopers should get pleasure and be involved in work. So my purpose is to create projects that are firstly aimed to increase Developer Experience. I believe that there should be no doubt when you do something.I never passed deadlinesall tasks are done in time.I`m a good team player. I like to communicate with teamplan daily team meetingsdiscuss tasks and project perspectives.Sohere is my CV. Looking forward to hear from you!

text_post: ['Pet Project 2 (Valencia schools map)Overallthe first experience of describing Pet Project seemed like an interesting challenge to me. Next Pet Project is not as extensive as the firstbut it might be interesting to someone. In generalthe idea for Pet Project 2 came about quite randomly as a result of two factors:-\xa0\xa0I discovered data parsing using Python-\xa0\xa0My family had the prospect of moving to Valencia.Since my daughter is just under 4 years oldthe question of finding a preschool and school in the new city becomes very important. In one of the chatsI came across a link to the website of the Generalitet Valencianawhich had information about all preschools and schools. The screenshot of the table is attached to this columnand you can see that this is a very difficult-to-perceive array of dataessentially a catalog of more than 3000 educational institutions.Accordinglya simple idea arose to parse the existing data and visualize this information in a more illustrative waynamelyby overlaying them on a cartographic basis using Tableau.The difficulty at the parsing stage was that the structure of information for each school is very heterogeneousand I had to limit the amount of extracted information quite significantly. ThereforeI decided to limit myself to displaying general information about the school (nameaddresstype of schooland information about options). In addition to thisthere are links to Google Maps and the page with full information about the school on the website of the Generalitet Valenciana.Nextit was interesting to implement a search for the set of available options in the school (a big thanks to Yuliya M. for her help)for which a separate Search Mode had to be created. Everything else is fairly standard: a filter by municipality and type of schooland adaptive layout for mobile phones was also successfully implemented.I like what turned out and it will be nice if this dashboard is useful to someone else. https://lnkd.in/dyueSD53#tableau #data #python #google #experience #school #petproject #valencia #spain

url_user: https://www.linkedin.com/in/vodyanoy?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAA5EHN0BrcBsDeEa908E-uWIPhLtF6McZuk;Vladislav Vodianoi;–†—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å –ø—Ä–æ–µ–∫—Ç–æ–≤ –ø–æ —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏–∏ –∏ —Ü–∏—Ñ—Ä–æ–≤–æ–π —Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—Å—Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ü–∏–∏.;"[""Digital transformationwhat does it mean for a company?Digital transformation is a shift from people-driven or process-driven organization to data-driven and model-driven one. Unfortunately it is not at allto fulfill this condition you must change all the company‚Äôs elements: business modelorganizational structurecorporate culture and IT infrastructure. Lets talk about this In the modern worldclients can switch from one product to another in 2 secondsbecause they mostly have one channel of communication - personal devices (SmartphoneDesktop etc) and all companies try to make a user experience easy and accessible. Before digital world the companys focused on manufacturing processbut now company should focused on customerin another world customer-centric company. #customercentricServitization. Nowadays a majority of customers don't want just to own the goodsthey want to have services which cover their needs. That‚Äôs why more companies shift from selling goods to selling services. For examplein B2C sector the companies provide carsharing (time of driving) instead of car rentstreaming services instead of movies (e.g. Netflix) etc. In B2B sector you can see the same trend. For example Hilti Company changed their business model from selling construction equipment to selling holes-making in the walls (the customers pay for the quantity of the holes made by using Hilti tools and they don‚Äôt need to buy and maintain the equipment). The Rolls-Royse company doesn't sell aero-enginesbut provides a period of the flight. #servitizationDigital platforms. Information technologies help to connect 2 or more different organizations for creating new quality servicefor example Taxi platforms. You can order and get a taxi for about 2 minutesand follow your driver route on your screen. Digital platforms significantly decrease transaction costs and timesetting a new standard of communication between 2 or more people (AlibabaAmazon).The modern business models require new knowledge about clients which allows the company to provide a unique service of high quality. It leads to the need of creating new IT infrastructure and gathering qualitative and quantitative data for making proper changes in business processes.\xa0#platformsHR procedures. Evidently the success of any business depends on people who work there and drive innovations. Human capital becomes the most valuable resource on the markets and companies have to pay huge efforts searching for a good staff and ensuring their integration and loyalty through the corporate cultureinternal support and motivation.Surely it is not an exhaustive list of elements of a digital transformation. It's only a helicopter view on the whole process of companies‚Äô changes in current digital trends.Wait for your comments and ready for further discussion on digital transformation.In the next step I will talk about why digital transformation is so complicated for a company.""]";['4'];0

url_user: https://www.linkedin.com/in/lazhintsev?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAB3wJ3wBnXm4E1Z6CXuyw0H6XQmRdAvCBDU;Vitaliy Lazhintsev;"CEO ""NooSoft""";" 'This is the end of a wonderful event in Moscow - the BRICS+ Forum!Many thanks to the organizers for the carefully designed eventthe opportunity to speak at a number of venues and meet a large number of active entrepreneurs!After listening to all the speakersI can confidently say that everyone who received awards deserved them. It was incredibly rewarding to hear unique stories of success and failure. Not everything always goes the way you would like.Already in 2023a restart will be carried out in the activities of international acceleration programs for entrepreneurs of the BRICS countries and at the site of the Omsk State Technical University - the BRICS International Business Incubator will be launched. The program will focus on developers and entrepreneurs in the field of creating and developing a technology business.The International Award ""TOP-100 Entrepreneurs of the Eurasian Economic Union"" will also be launched together with partners from the Eurasian Investment Agency. Very sooncolleagues will announce the start of accepting applications for this Award.The creation of the BRICS Youth Economic Councilwhich will include entrepreneursincluding the winners of the International Award ""TOP-100 BRICS Entrepreneurs""is being considered.The possibility of launching the Association of New Commodity-Import Cooperation and building new logistics routes is being considered. And this is only part of the decisions and historical plans! We are working!";['8'2'4'2'5'3'3'4'1'2'2'4'1'];0

https://www.linkedin.com/in/lazhintsev?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAB3wJ3wBnXm4E1Z6CXuyw0H6XQmRdAvCBDU;Vitaliy Lazhintsev;"CEO ""NooSoft""";" 'We have completed a new project!The customer is a network of Consultative and Diagnostic Centers ""Child and Adult Health"" - a modern network of family clinics for children and adults. In the doctor\'s cardyou can leave a reviewstudy the biographywhich turned out to be very interesting.The project turned out to be very interestingand many of our employees fell in love with the clinic and appreciated many of the services. Digital transformation is a great program and it\'s good that progress is making progress. Howeverwe also understand the risksfor examplethe lack of demand for some new services: after allwe manage changes. Thank you so much for the invitation!""Independent"" is the first Internet channel of intellectualsa guide to the world from the world\'s leading experts.Live link: https://lnkd.in/gKSzhrdJ";['8'2'4'2'5'3'3'4'1'2'2'4'1'];0

Altai Territory ‚Äùof the Skolkovo Open University! Together with colleagueswe took part in the jury.The main goal of the project was to spark young people with the idea of \u200b\u200btheir own businessso that they learn the tools to achieve success.Studentspostgraduatesyoung scientists and engineers of the Altai Territory took part in the development and presentation of business projects.The 1st place was won by the team that presented the project ""Vegetable marmalade"". It will help parents instill in their children a love of vegetablesreduce fiber and vitamin deficiencies.The experts gave the 2nd place to the project of the social center ""I am with you"" with a program of trainings for psychologists and teachers aimed at improving the skills of working with children from orphanages.The 3rd place was taken by the ‚ÄúSmart Earplugs‚Äù teamwhich developed a project of smart headphones with the function of vibration alarm and tracking sleep phases.The teams were awarded with memorable prizes from the Skolkovo Open University.The participants of the final with the projects ""Phoebe"" and ""Second Life"" received special prizes.All program participants received certificates from the Skolkovo Foundationand UMNIK grant recipients received certificates of completion of the pre-acceleration program.The expert jury of the finals included:‚Ä¢ Aleksey Viktorovich ErokhinDeputy Minister of Economic Development of the Altai TerritoryHead of the Department for Innovative Development and Cluster Policy;‚Ä¢ Sergey A. KorennovDirector of the Altai Center for Cluster Development;‚Ä¢ Lazhintsev Vitaly Evgenievichhead of the Internet agency ""Alliance +""public representative of ASI in the direction of ""Youth entrepreneurship"";‚Ä¢ Ekaterina MorozovaDirector of the Skolkovo Open University;‚Ä¢ Savinkov Vitaly Vladimirovichexecutive director of LLC ""SeaSort"";‚Ä¢ Sheludyakov Oleg Alexandrovichpublic representative of ASI in the direction of ""Entrepreneurship and Technology"";‚Ä¢ Dmitry Belousovexecutive director of the Altai biopharmaceutical cluster.‚Ä¢ Daria KharchenkoEducational Advisor of the Internet Initiatives Development Fund (IIDF)speaker of the Innovator\'s Navigator program.";['8'2'4'2'5'3'3'4'1'2'2'4'1'];0

The company is the official partner of RACER. Todaythe salon has a wide range of various equipmentfrom bicycles to snowmobiles.Our task was to create a pleasant and convenient site-catalog of goods with a multifunctionalflexible filteras well as with a strict and consistent design. After several meetings and negotiations with customersthe logic of the project was developedthe terms of reference with the UX prototypes of the site.The logo and design of 6 unique pages was created.A long work was done with the functionality and flexibility of the filter and catalog: one of the main features of the site is its logic and arsenal of options. https://www.linkedin.com/in/lazhintsev?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAB3wJ3wBnXm4E1Z6CXuyw0H6XQmRdAvCBDU;Vitaliy Lazhintsev;"CEO ""NooSoft""";" 'We have completed a new brand book!LLC ""TsGS"" - a company that is engaged in the disposalcollectiontransportation and treatment of waste in the Ural Federal District. LLC ""TsGS"" has been recycling tiresoilsbatteries for over 20 years.The first stage of our work was the development of the logo. We discussed with the client in detail the requirements for the logothe color paletteand made a sketch. We provided 3 variants of the logoone of whichtogether with the clientwas selected and finalized.The next stage of work was to create a brand book of the company in accordance with the chosen style.It was decided to develop 11 elements:- Business card- Presentation- Form- Post templates for social networks- Account headers for Vkontakte and Facebook- Greeting card template- Booklet- Modular grid for print and outdoor advertising- Vehicle sticker- Stand- Promotional flyerAfter approval of the design of all elementswe created a guide for using the corporate identity of the company. It contains all the rules for using prepared elementscolor palette and selected fonts. The customer can change the filling of all prepared templates independently for specific tasks.The customer is already actively using the brand book!\xa0Full project history: https://lnkd.in/gFTB9FD #design #brand #business #logo";['8'2'4'2'5'3'3'4'1'2'2'4'1'];0

name: Zlata Dyachkova
text_post: ['I have been working with staff since 2011. Qualified business coach and HR. I will be happy to help you in your personal and professional developmentsupport you in finding a jobhelp you to realize yourself in a new place and build good relationships in the team. If you are a leaderthen together with you we will establish hr processes in the companyI will be engaged in the selection and training of a recruiter. If you are a specialist and you need to build a system of selection and adaptation in the companyplease contact us before experience and knowledge. Todayour marketing team is  experiencing it to bring a joyful fresh content.So - which car should we do next?Credits: gowago.ch#marketing #midjourney #chatgpt4 #brand #cars #switzerland""My top 7 mistakes raising $200M from investors: (and how to avoid them)";['20'19'111\xa0750'1\xa0183'33\xa0171'2\xa0745'17\xa0303'2\xa0375'1'4\xa0785'5'599'1'2'];0

https://www.linkedin.com/in/shakhbazov?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAABHsuYBYdf-uFybp8q5JZRl_Ia6XwXoNcI;–ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ–π –®–∞—Ö–±–∞–∑–æ–≤;–¢—Ä–µ–∫–µ—Ä –∏ –º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ—Ä;" ""Here's another personal project I completed in October 2021. I created 31 unique walk cycle animations that captured different personalitiesmovementsand emotions. The project was both challenging and rewardingas I pushed myself to create animations on a daily basis. It demanded discipline and dedicationbut the sense of accomplishment made it all worthwhile. You can explore the entire collection of animations on my website: https://lnkd.in/dGD-yFAh#aftereffects\xa0#2danimation\xa0#characteranimation\xa0#motiongraphics""Now you know how it really worksBy digital creator Sam CÃßakmak - see his other great work @samcakmak_ Shared with permission from Sam";['20'19'111\xa0750'1\xa0183'33\xa0171'2\xa0745'17\xa0303'2\xa0375'1'4\xa0785'5'599'1'2'];0

https://www.linkedin.com/in/shakhbazov?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAABHsuYBYdf-uFybp8q5JZRl_Ia6XwXoNcI;–ê–Ω–¥—Ä–µ–π –®–∞—Ö–±–∞–∑–æ–≤;–¢—Ä–µ–∫–µ—Ä –∏ –º–µ–Ω—Ç–æ—Ä;" 'I‚Äôm using ChatGPT 50-70 times a day. I‚Äôm terrible at tech. This is how I use it.(Firstcan we please move beyond ‚ÄúWrite an email to my boss!‚Äù or ‚ÄúCreate 25 taglines for my business!‚Äù It‚Äôs like discovering the iPhone and being like ""Hey it‚Äôs a flashlight! Everyone! Flashlight!!‚Äù)Here are five more awesome ways of using ChatGPT:1.) Research the person you‚Äôre meeting.You already do this - now try it with AI. Example: ‚ÄúTomorrow I‚Äôm meeting Morgan Stanley CPO Mandell Crawley. Give me 5 talking points about challenges he is facing and 3 about his background and career path.‚Äù Tell ChatGPT to dig deeper on these points.[BIG caveat: GPT systems are prone to ‚Äòhallucinate‚Äô (give you false info). I highly recommend running the same query through Bing‚Äôs chat and Google Bard. If you‚Äôre running through ChatGPTnote that it‚Äôs memory stops in Sept. 2021 (unless you have a browsing plug-in). Check your work!2.) Become the ideal applicant.You‚Äôve found the perfect job posting. Tell ChatGPT ‚ÄúI‚Äôm giving you a job descriptionfollowed by my resume. Tweak the language in my experiences and improve phrasing to make me a better match for the joband highlight what I can say in the interview.‚Äù It‚Äôll do wonders with recruiting algorithms and narrow-minded recruiters.3.) Stop slogging through boring videos.Need to watch a Youtube video to learn about a topic? Stop cranking it to 2x and trying to catch the gist. Below the videoclick the three dots. Click ‚ÄòShow transcript.‚Äô Select and copy. Tell ChatGPT ‚ÄúSummarize this in 5 sentenceshighlight any mention of XYZ and ignore time stamps.‚Äù Something catch your eye? Tell ChatGPT ‚ÄúTell me more about XYZ.‚Äù4.) Benchmark stuff.Even the *word* benchmarking is boring. It‚Äôs labor-intensive and is rarely prioritizedbut is critical for your work. I‚Äôm at NYU Sternso I tell ChatGPT ‚ÄúGive me 10 other MBA programs that have a Fintech club and what activities they‚Äôve been running.‚Äù Knowing what peers are doing will level-set you in about 2 minutes. (If you want more recent than Sept 2021use Bing in Creative mode.)5.) Ask ChatGPT whether or not you sprained your ankle.ChatGPT is really good at medical advice - you just have to ask the right way. (Disclaimer: Check with a doctorduh.) The program will focus on developers and entrepreneurs in the field of creating and developing a technology business.The International Award ""TOP-100 Entrepreneurs of the Eurasian Economic Union"" will also be launched together with partners from the Eurasian Investment Agency. Very sooncolleagues will announce the start of accepting applications for this Award.The creation of the BRICS Youth Economic Councilwhich will include entrepreneursincluding the winners of the International Award ""TOP-100 BRICS Entrepreneurs""is being considered.The possibility of launching the Association of New Commodity-Import Cooperation and building new logistics routes is being considered. And this is only part of the decisions and historical plans! We are working!";['8'2'4'2'5'3'3'4'1'2'2'4'1'];0

https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAAB3wJ3wBnXm4E1Z6CXuyw0H6XQmRdAvCBDU?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAB3wJ3wBnXm4E1Z6CXuyw0H6XQmRdAvCBDU;Vitaliy Lazhintsev;"CEO ""NooSoft""";" 'The acceleration program ‚ÄúInnovator\'s Navigator. It will help parents instill in their children a love of vegetablesreduce fiber and vitamin deficiencies.The experts gave the 2nd place to the project of the social center ""I am with you"" with a program of trainings for psychologists and teachers aimed at improving the skills of working with children from orphanages.The 3rd place was taken by the ‚ÄúSmart Earplugs‚Äù teamwhich developed a project of smart headphones with the function of vibration alarm and tracking sleep phases.The teams were awarded with memorable prizes from the Skolkovo Open University.The participants of the final with the projects ""Phoebe"" and ""Second Life"" received special prizes.All program participants received certificates from the Skolkovo Foundationand UMNIK grant recipients received certificates of completion of the pre-acceleration program.The expert jury of the finals included:‚Ä¢ Aleksey Viktorovich ErokhinDeputy Minister of Economic Development of the Altai TerritoryHead of the Department for Innovative Development and Cluster Policy;‚Ä¢ Sergey A. KorennovDirector of the Altai Center for Cluster Development;‚Ä¢ Lazhintsev Vitaly Evgenievichhead of the Internet agency ""Alliance +""public representative of ASI in the direction of ""Youth entrepreneurship"";‚Ä¢ Ekaterina MorozovaDirector of the Skolkovo Open University;‚Ä¢ Savinkov Vitaly Vladimirovichexecutive director of LLC ""SeaSort"";‚Ä¢ Sheludyakov Oleg Alexandrovichpublic representative of ASI in the direction of ""Entrepreneurship and Technology"";‚Ä¢ Dmitry Belousovexecutive director of the Altai biopharmaceutical cluster.‚Ä¢ Daria KharchenkoEducational Advisor of the Internet Initiatives Development Fund (IIDF)speaker of the Innovator\'s Navigator program.";['8'2'4'2'5'3'3'4'1'2'2'4'1'];0

LLC ""TsGS"" has been recycling tiresoilsbatteries for over 20 years.The first stage of our work was the development of the logo. We discussed with the client in detail the requirements for the logothe color paletteand made a sketch. We provided 3 variants of the logoone of whichtogether with the clientwas selected and finalized.The next stage of work was to create a brand book of the company in accordance with the chosen style.It was decided to develop 11 elements:- Business card- Presentation- Form- Post templates for social networks- Account headers for Vkontakte and Facebook- Greeting card template- Booklet- Modular grid for print and outdoor advertising- Vehicle sticker- Stand- Promotional flyerAfter approval of the design of all elementswe created a guide for using the corporate identity of the company. It contains all the rules for using prepared elementscolor palette and selected fonts. The customer can change the filling of all prepared templates independently for specific tasks.The customer is already actively using the brand book!\xa0Full project history: https://lnkd.in/gFTB9FD #design #brand #business #logo";['8'2'4'2'5'3'3'4'1'2'2'4'1'];0

https://www.linkedin.com/in/ACoAAB3wJ3wBnXm4E1Z6CXuyw0H6XQmRdAvCBDU?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAB3wJ3wBnXm4E1Z6CXuyw0H6XQmRdAvCBDU;Vitaliy Lazhintsev;"CEO ""NooSoft""";" ""We have completed a new project!NPP Engineering is an engineering company that offers comprehensive solutions in the field of deep processing of grainfrom receipt from the field to the entire process chainincluding waste processing. Throughout the entire period of activitythe company's experts have been creating unique technological solutions to change the qualitative and quantitative indicators of products.Our task was to develop a modern Internet resource that would serve as a reliable sales channel and attract new partners for the customer.Equipment catalog by industry and typeengineering servicesmetalworkingtechnical auditinstallation supervisioncommissioningdescription of completed projects - all this had to be presented on the website.Based on the wishes of the Customer and the requirements for the projectan audit of a niche of business and competitors was made and a technical task was developed with UX prototypes of the site. Then we started developing the site design according to the terms of reference and layoutusing the corporate colors and the company's brand book. 8 unique pages have been created.For the convenience of the company's clientsa roadmap for cooperation was carefully worked outwhich clearly shows all stages from the first call to the finished project. WordPress was chosen as the CMS. Initial SEO optimization has been performed on the site.Project creation history: https://lnkd.in/gqTCfG7""–° —Ä–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç—å—é —Å–æ–æ–±—â–∞—é—á—Ç–æ —è #–û–∫–∞–∑—ã–≤–∞—é_–±–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å_—É—Å–ª—É–≥–∏. –ü—Ä–µ–¥–ª–∞–≥–∞–µ–º—ã–µ —É—Å–ª—É–≥–∏: –í–µ–±-—Ä–∞–∑—Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–∫–∞–ú–∞—Ä–∫–µ—Ç–∏–Ω–≥ –≤ —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç—è—Ö–í–µ–±-–¥–∏–∑–∞–π–Ω–ò–¢-–∫–æ–Ω—Å–∞–ª—Ç–∏–Ω–≥–ü–æ–∏—Å–∫–æ–≤—ã–π –º–∞—Ä–∫–µ—Ç–∏–Ω–≥ (SEM)–û–ø—Ç–∏–º–∏–∑–∞—Ü–∏—è –¥–ª—è –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–æ–≤—ã—Ö —Å–∏—Å—Ç–µ–º (SEO) –∏ –ú–∞—Ä–∫–µ—Ç–∏–Ω–≥–æ–≤—ã–π –∫–æ–Ω—Å–∞–ª—Ç–∏–Ω–≥.']";['8'2'4'2'5'3'3'4'1'2'2'4'1'];0

They provide a general reusable solution for the common issues occurring during software development. üîπ1. Backends for Frontends Pattern (BFF): Tailored backend for each user interface.üîπ2. Strangler Fig Pattern: Gradual replacement of monolithic systems.üîπ3. API Gateway Pattern: Single-entry point to microservices system.üîπ4. Service Discovery Pattern: Locate services dynamically in a network.üîπ5. Circuit Breaker Pattern: Prevent cascaded failureenable recovery.üîπ6. Bulkhead Pattern: Isolate failures and prevent system-wide impact.üîπ7. Retry Pattern: Reattempt operation in case of failure.üîπ8. Sidecar Pattern: Application extension with helper services.üîπ9. Saga Pattern: Maintain data consistency across microservices.üîπ10. CQRS (Command Query Responsibility Segregation) Pattern: Separate read and write operations.üîπ11. Composite Microservices Pattern: Orchestrates multiple servicesaggregates results.üîπ12. Configuration Externalization Pattern: Externalize configurations for environmental consistency.‚Äî‚Äî‚ÄîRef: ùóöùóøùóºùó∏ùó∏ùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùó†ùó∂ùó∞ùóøùóºùòÄùó≤ùóøùòÉùó∂ùó∞ùó≤ùòÄ ùóóùó≤ùòÄùó∂ùó¥ùóª ùó£ùóÆùòÅùòÅùó≤ùóøùóªùòÄ -\xa0https://lnkd.in/gDMtPQxi‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî#systemdesign #microservices #coding #interviewtips";['1\xa0084'40'3'3'4'1'8'2'1'1'5'];0

text_post: ['–í—Å–µ–º –ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç! üëÄ –°–µ–π—á–∞—Å –≤ –ø–æ–∏—Å–∫–µ middle/senior Data Scientis –≤ –æ–¥–∏–Ω –∏–∑ –ª–∏–¥–µ—Ä–æ–≤ —Ä—ã–Ω–∫–∞ –∞–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Ç—Ä–µ–π–¥–∏–Ω–≥–∞. –û–±—è–∑–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–∞—è —Ä–µ–ª–æ–∫–∞—Ü–∏—è –≤ –ê—Ä–º–µ–Ω–∏—é–ø—Ä–µ–¥–æ—Å—Ç–∞–≤–ª—è–µ–º –ø–æ–ª–Ω—ã–π —Ä–µ–ª–æ–∫ –ø–∞–∫–µ—Ç. –ù–∞ —Ç–µ—Ä—Ä–∏—Ç–æ—Ä–∏–∏ –ê—Ä–º–µ–Ω–∏–∏ —É–¥–∞–ª–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —Ñ–æ—Ä–º–∞—Ç —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã–ü–æ –∑/–ø - –æ—Ä–∏–µ–Ω—Ç–∏—Ä—É–µ–º—Å—è –Ω–∞ –≤–∞—à–∏ –ø–æ–∂–µ–ª–∞–Ω–∏—è.–ò–∑ –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Ç—Ä–µ–±–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–π - –æ–ø—ã—Ç –≤ —Ä–æ–ª–∏ Data Science\xa0–æ—Ç 15 –ª–µ—Ç.ML/DLNLP\xa0Python –∏–ª–∏ C++. –ó–∞ –ø–æ–¥—Ä–æ–±–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—è–º–∏ –º–æ–∂–Ω–æ –≤ –ª–∏—á–∫—É –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –∏–ª–∏ –≤ —Ç–µ–ª–µ–≥—Ä–∞–º–º - http://t.me/ITaisiya P.S. –±—É–¥—É —Ä–∞–¥–∞ –ª–∞–π–∫–∞–º –∏ —Ä–µ–ø–æ—Å—Ç–∞–º! –ê –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ—Ç–ª–∏–∫–∞–º üíì #data \ufeff#ml #nlp #datascience #python #work #vacancy

name: Tamara Tsulaya
text_post: ['Held a webinar about the features of OSS analysis in software development in cooperation with the Information Security Department of Innotech ùêíùêÆùê¶ùê¶ùêöùê´ùê≤:üîµ Copyright compliance is mandatory regardless of country of origin.üîµ Strong copyleft is not a blocking term for using an open component. Howeverit is important to contact a lawyer for reviewing the terms and license requirements. üîµ Third party notices ‚Äì must have for each IT product which is subject to commercialize. üîµ OSS Policy ‚Äì a crucial document within IP compliance procedure which allows to create a global business process in a company and formulate a transparent approach. üîµ AutoScoring Software ‚Äì must have for analyzing vulnerabilities and dependencies. Many thanks to Heather Meeker for the best practices. #software #compliance #webinar #lawyer #business #softwaredevelopment #informationsecurity #legal #technology #IT

url_user: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tamara-tsulaya-5b6b041b2?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAADGkQloBX5M09k2HduAC4HcbMhxHnMiDlL8;Tamara Tsulaya;Senior Legal Counsel (IT&IP);" ""ùêñùê¢ùê•ùê• ùê†ùê¢ùê≠ùê°ùêÆùêõ ùêõùêû ùêõùê•ùê®ùêúùê§ùêûùêù? üò±Last weeka business meeting was held in Moscow to discuss the prospects for of Open Source development in Russia. The meeting was attended by small companiesIT giantsas well as the OSS community. Everyone shared their experience of using OSS solutions when developing their own software.Once again I was convinced that the legal regulation of OSS is not given due importance. Only technical advantages are discussedbut no one talks about the legal risks and negative consequences of illegal use of open components. But this is a lyric.The main topic was the start of an experiment to create a national OSS repository. This topic continues to cause me curiositydoubts and questions.üü¶  In my opinionthe national repository will never replace the #github. The community of Russian developers is really very large. But what should encourage them to place their solutions in an internal no-name repositorydepriving themselves of the opportunity to demonstrate their skills to the whole world?üü¶ What licenses will regulate OSS?üü¶ As far as I understandonly secure software will be included in the repository. Does this mean that companies can‚Äôt spend money and resources on information security complianceand the state will compensate for the losses due to the code with a vulnerability that was taken from the repository? If no one is willing to make amendswhat's the advantage of creating a local repository? üü¶ How will the illegal copy-paste of OSS from #github and the placement of this code in the national repository under someone else's authorship be monitored and regulated?In generalthere are many questionsbut so far few answers. #github #opensource #IT #developing #law #repository #copyright #technology #software #business #development #compliance #legal #informationsecurity""üîé ùêëùêûùê¶ùê®ùêØùê¢ùêßùê† ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùê¢ùêßùêüùê®ùê´ùê¶ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêüùê´ùê®ùê¶ ùêÜùê®ùê®ùê†ùê•ùêû ùê¨ùêûùêöùê´ùêúùê° ùê´ùêûùê¨ùêÆùê•ùê≠ùê¨: ùê∞ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùê¢ùê¨ ùê≠ùê°ùêû ""ùê´ùê¢ùê†ùê°ùê≠ ùê≠ùê® ùêõùêû ùêüùê®ùê´ùê†ùê®ùê≠ùê≠ùêûùêß""?The right to be forgotten is a legal concept that allows individuals to request the removal of personal data on a search engine like #Googleany links to information that you have requested to be removed will not appear in the search results. This right is based on the idea that individuals should have control over their own #personaldata and the ability to determine how it is used and shared.ùêñùê°ùêûùêß ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê´ùê¢ùê†ùê°ùê≠ ùê≠ùê® ùêõùêû ùêüùê®ùê´ùê†ùê®ùê≠ùê≠ùêûùêß ùêöùê©ùê©ùê•ùê≤?‚úîÔ∏è Personal data is no longer necessary for the purpose it was collected. The data is being processed illegally if the individual objects to the processing of their data. ‚úîÔ∏è Data is inaccurate or incomplete and needs to be updated or erased. üíÅ\u200d‚ôÄÔ∏è ùêñùê°ùê® ùêúùêöùêß ùê¶ùêöùê§ùêû ùêö ùê´ùê¢ùê†ùê°ùê≠ ùê≠ùê® ùêõùêû ùêüùê®ùê´ùê†ùê®ùê≠ùê≠ùêûùêß ùê´ùêûùê™ùêÆùêûùê¨ùê≠?Any individual has the right to make a right to be forgotten request. Specific requirements and procedures for making a request may vary depending on the jurisdiction and the organization holding the data. I.e. Russia has a data protection law that allows individuals to request the deletion or correction of their personal data If it is inaccurateincompleteor processed unlawfully. ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùê≠ùê® ùêùùêûùê•ùêûùê≠ùêû ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùêùùêöùê≠ùêö (ùê®ùêß ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêûùê±ùêöùê¶ùê©ùê•ùêû ùê®ùêü ùêÜùê®ùê®ùê†ùê•ùêû)?Fill the web form to submit a request including the following:‚úîÔ∏è The specific URL(s) for the content that you want delisted. ‚úîÔ∏è A description of how the content is related to youand why Google should delist it from Google search results.‚úîÔ∏è The search query for which you‚Äôd like Google to delist the content (i.e. your full name). ‚úîÔ∏è An email address where you can be reached.#privacy #GDPR #CCPA #law #technology #legal #Education";['3'2'1'1'4'1'1'];0

name: Tamara Tsulaya
text_post: 'A few days agoa scammer Elena Blinovskaya was arrested for tax evasion in the amount of $21 million. She has more than 5 million followers on Instagram. Elena is known as a life and business coach. ActuallyElena is a symbol of scam in Russia. üîî As long as ordinary people believe in successful success and the breath of the uterusscammers will be rich and happydeceiving goofs. üì¢ ùêÇùê´ùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùêúùêöùê• ùê≠ùê°ùê¢ùêßùê§ùê¢ùêßùê† ùê°ùêöùê¨ ùê•ùêûùêüùê≠ ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêúùê°ùêöùê≠. ùêñùê°ùê≤ ùê©ùêûùê®ùê©ùê•ùêû ùêõùêûùê•ùê¢ùêûùêØùêû ùê¨ùêúùêöùê¶ùê¶ùêûùê´ùê¨? 1. They desperate to achieve success in a particular area of their life and may be more vulnerable to the promises made by scam coaches. 2. Some people may not have a lot of experience or knowledge in the area where the coach is offering their services. This can make it difficult for them to distinguish between legitimate coaches and scam artists. 3. Scammers may use fake proofs to have worked with celebrities to make themselves seem more attractive. 4. They may use emotional manipulation tactics to gain the trust of followers. They may use fearguiltor other emotions to make their followers feel like they need their advices and services. ùêèùê•ùêûùêöùê¨ùêûùêùùê®ùêß‚Äôùê≠ ùêõùêû ùê•ùê¢ùê§ùêû ùê≠ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùê©ùêûùê®ùê©ùê•ùêû. ùêíùê∞ùê¢ùê≠ùêúùê° ùê®ùêß ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùêõùê´ùêöùê¢ùêß.‚òù #success #people #experience #business #instagram #scam #coach #balance #life #fraud

url_user: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tamara-tsulaya-5b6b041b2?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAADGkQloBX5M09k2HduAC4HcbMhxHnMiDlL8;Tamara Tsulaya;Senior Legal Counsel (IT&IP);" 'ùêÇùêöùêß ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê©ùêöùêßùê¢ùêûùê¨ ùêÆùê¨ùêû ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê´ùêûùê¨ùêÆùê•ùê≠ùê¨ ùê®ùêü #ùêÇùê°ùêöùê≠ùêÜùêèùêì ùêüùê´ùêûùêûùê•ùê≤? ü§î One second and voila! You get unique contentsuch as your company logo. You can confidently register your brand and start conquering the world! Is it really that simple?   üî¥ By defaultthe generated content is the result you obtained using AI algorithms. ChatGPT is an AI owned by OpenAI. Thusthe content produced by AI platforms is owned by the company.  Terms of Use are specified that ""Subject to your compliance with these Termsùêéùê©ùêûùêßùêÄùêà ùê°ùêûùê´ùêûùêõùê≤ ùêöùê¨ùê¨ùê¢ùê†ùêßùê¨ ùê≠ùê® ùê≤ùê®ùêÆ ùêöùê•ùê• ùê¢ùê≠ùê¨ ùê´ùê¢ùê†ùê°ùê≠title and interest in and to Output. This means ùê≤ùê®ùêÆ ùêúùêöùêß ùêÆùê¨ùêû ùêÇùê®ùêßùê≠ùêûùêßùê≠ ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêöùêßùê≤ ùê©ùêÆùê´ùê©ùê®ùê¨ùêûùê¢ùêßùêúùê•ùêÆùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê¶ùêûùê´ùêúùê¢ùêöùê• ùê©ùêÆùê´ùê©ùê®ùê¨ùêûùê¨ such as sale or publicationif you comply with these Terms.""   Note that the transfer of all rights to the generated result to the user is at the discretion of the companynothing more.   üî¥ Other AI platforms may not be OK with transferring ownership rights to the user. Using content without the consent of the rights holder violates their intellectual property rights. The company is entitled to claim damages.   üî• ùêÄùêßùêù ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê¶ùê®ùê¨ùê≠ ùê¢ùêßùê≠ùêûùê´ùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê†!  üî¥ Can a company really prove that a user or a company are illegally use content generated specifically on its platform? AI is a code with a lot of algorithms created by developers. But anywaythe result of generating content is random.   It will be interesting to see how legal regulation of this miracle technology develops.#technology #content #algorithms #legal #intellectualproperty #AI #openai #business #IT #law #chatbot #python #artificialintelligence";['3'2'1'1'4'1'1'];0

name: Tamara Tsulaya
text_post: 'ùêÇùê®ùê®ùê§ùê¢ùêû ùêüùê¢ùê•ùêûùê¨ ùê®ùê´ ùê°ùê®ùê∞ ùê≠ùê® ùê©ùê´ùê®ùê≠ùêûùêúùê≠ ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùêùùêöùê≠ùêö? üôåWith the advent of the Internetcompanies have new tools to optimize their investment in marketing campaigns. By collecting and analyzing information about users and their actionscompanies identify the target audience and broadcast advertisements to it (targeted advertising). The collection and analysis of information is carried outamong other thingsthrough the use of cookies.Cookies are small text files that remain on computers and smartphones after visiting websites. Cookies are sent to the server when opening web pages and are used for statistical and marketing research. They allow the collection of data on consumer interests.According to the GDPRinformation obtained through cookies can be recognized as personalbut only in conjunction with information that allows you to identify a specific person. In order to comply with the GDPRit is recommended to first analyze the nature and purpose of the information collected.To comply with the regulations governing cookies under the GDPR and the ePrivacy Directive websites ùê¶ùêÆùê¨ùê≠ ùêùùê® the following:1. Receive users‚Äô consent before you use any cookies\xa0except\xa0strictly necessary cookies.2. Provide accurate and specific information about the data each cookie tracks and its purpose in plain language before consent is received.3. Document and store consent received from users.4. Allow users to access your service even if they refuse to allow the use of certain cookies5. Make it as easy for users to withdraw their consent as it was for them to give their consent in the first place.ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùê≠ùê® ùê©ùê´ùê®ùê≠ùêûùêúùê≠ ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùêùùêöùê≠ùêö? üëÅ\u200düó®1. Refuse the use of cookies or change their settings.2. Set a ban on saving cookies on devices using browser settings (but in some cases this leads to incorrect operation of sites). 3. Visit sites in incognito mode.4. Delete cookies from time to time.\xa0#gdpr #data #IT #privacy #cookie #law #websites

url_user: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tamara-tsulaya-5b6b041b2?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAADGkQloBX5M09k2HduAC4HcbMhxHnMiDlL8;Tamara Tsulaya;Senior Legal Counsel (IT&IP);" ""In order to get a number of advantages in the Russian marketIT companies can add its software to the Russian Software Register. The decision on inclusion in the Register is made by the Ministry of Telecom and Mass Communications on the basis of methodological recommendations (https://lnkd.in/dvFyi6Pw). According to the Recommendations (cl. 4)if the key OpenSource components included in the software are licensed under the terms of the GPLMPL and other copyleft licensesthen the software will not be included in the Register.Does this mean a prohibition on inclusion in the Registry any software that contains OpenSource components under the terms of GPLMPL licenses? In my opinionnoit doesn't.The decision to include the software in the Register is made by the expert councilwhich analyzes the technical features of the software. If third-party components are licensed under the terms of the GPLMPLetc.but don‚Äôt play a crucial role in the operation of the software or are used by linking librariessuch software may be included the Registry.A lot of russian operating systems are developed on the basis of Linux componentswhich are licensed under the terms of the GPL. It would be interesting to study the experts' arguments when deciding to include such software in the Register.The main feature of most copyleft licenses is that if an OpenSource component is used under the terms of copyleft licensethen the software as a whole must be distributed under copyleft license. This entails the obligation to disclose the source code of the entire product at the request of the user who purchased the product. #software #linux #opensource #IT #legal #GPL""Just finished the course ‚ÄúGDPR: Reglamento europeo de protecci√≥n de datos‚Äù! #governmentregulations #generaldataprotectionregulation']";['3'2'1'1'4'1'1'];0

url_user: https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexeyvylegzhanin?miniProfileUrn=urn%3Ali%3Afs_miniProfile%3AACoAAAOckQABLbA5RrKzug8-6J0dwKAMDt9nK9s;–ê–ª–µ–∫—Å–µ–π –í—ã–ª–µ–≥–∂–∞–Ω–∏–Ω;–°–ø–µ—Ü–∏–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç –ø–æ –ò–¢;"[""Hello LinkedIn community!I am currently on the lookout for new opportunities in the marketing sphere in London or Amsterdamand I am seeking a position with visa sponsorship. As a marketing professional with more than 10 years of experienceI am confident in my ability to contribute to a team and make a positive impact on the business.I have a passion for developing innovative marketing strategies and executing effective campaigns that drive growth and engagement. My experience spans digital and traditional marketing channelsincluding BTLsocial mediaemail marketingcontent marketingand events. I have a track record of achieving targetscollaborating with cross-functional teamsand maintaining strong relationships with clients.I am open to exploring various roles within the marketing fieldincluding marketing managerbrand manageror digital marketer. IdeallyI am looking for a company that values creativityinnovationand teamwork. I am eager to take on new challenges that will help me grow as a marketing professional.As I am seeking visa sponsorshipI would appreciate any recommendations or referrals to companies that offer sponsorship opportunities. If you have any suggestions or would like to connectplease don't hesitate to reach out to me via LinkedIn.Thank you for taking the time to read my post! name: Anastasia Avdonkina
text_post: 'Recruiting doesn‚Äôt work.  And here is why:  1. Companies hire only active candidates who apply for jobs 2. 70% of the global workforce of passive candidates is being ignored 3. Recruiters spam candidates with job proposals and don‚Äôt build relationships 4. Zero personalisation in communication 5. Candidates feel commoditised and ghosted  Since I don‚Äôt like BS and useless contentI started the insane project:  Analyse 10‚Äô000 cold emails to candidates by 100+ recruiters globally ü§Ø  I spent 6 months on this and selected ONLY the BEST PERFORMING emails sent by recruiters.  Here is a goldmine for all recruitersheadhuntershiring managersTA leadersand HR ü§©  Each email has details about:  üëâ Personalisation üëâ Pitching  üëâ Call-to-actions   You will find the best cold email frameworks with amazing resultsüëá  Open rate 75-80% Reply rate 20% Interest rate 5-8%  Thanks to this approach I headhunted:  1. VP Sales in UAE in 3 weeks 2. Senior principal engineer in Europe in 4 weeks 3. Senior IT consultant in the USA in 2 weeks   This killer email template will help you recruit cold candidates weeks faster and fill the most difficult roles üôå  You‚Äôre probably asking yourself:  ‚ÄúHow can I get access to this ASTONISHING resource that will be a game changer for my recruiting?‚Äù  It‚Äôs easy to receive the ebook:  Connect with me ‚úÖ Like & comment on this post ‚úÖ  And I‚Äôll send you in DMs.  P.S. The offer ends on June 1st. Hurry up. P.S.S. If you repost this post I‚Äôve got a surprise for you üòçüòé
